data.title: Nice place in strip center
data.text: I had sushi, soup and fried rice - all were prepared very well and the sushi was very fresh.  I went for lunch, but looked at the dinner menu.  Looked a tad pricey, but I would definitely go back for lunch.

data.title: Hot sake is great and half price during happy hour.
data.text: My husband loves the soft shell crab appetizer and the hot sake.  My favorite is the hot jasmine tea and garlic shrimp.

data.title: Ok for a quick post-shopping lunch
data.text: The bento box with teriyaki chicken is pretty good. If you have special wishes for soft drinks, they might not have it as their drinks menu is a little limited.

data.title: sashimi B bento box lunch
data.text: I was happy with the sashimi B bento box lunch. Also their basil chicken is very good! We like the lychee martini and snow crab appetizer.

data.title: woeful service
data.text:
A late Saturday afternoon visit, while quiet, suggested a good service.
The start was promising as two people vied to serve us drinks so confused us as to who the server actually was.
The place looked good, only spoiled by uncleared tables.
We ordered a sweet and sour chicken and a shrimp dish and it was promising that the accompanying rice reached the table promptly.
Alas, the rest of the meal didn’t arrive and after cajoling the server and still left waiting I requested the rice be removed and be replaced with fresh bowls when the main was ready.
Despite the lengthy wait the food was decent enough, but first impressions count and the service wasted the experience. It was quite apparent that we arrived at the end of the waiters shift and our presence was an inconvenience that prevented him from his external activities.
Hard to imagine we will be back anytime soon.

data.title: Enjoyable Dining in Nice Setting at Snow Pea
data.text: Our group of 10 really enjoyed Snow Pea, and the staff was helpful in getting us seated and our meals ordered very quickly. With a group, you appreciate that. Service was excellent. And everyone pleased with their meal. Definitely will be back. I appreciate they have brown rice available, Our 2 chicken dishes were very good. Many options in the $10 - $12 entree range. We plan to return for lunch again.  Would be nice for dinner, too, since it's decor is more "upscale" than your usual Chinese restaurant.

data.title: Snow Pea
data.text: This is my 5th time at the Snow Pea Asian Bistro and have not been disappointed. Service is great and romantic. I've been here with my wife and also my grandchildren. I've had the Scrimp spring rolls, and the scrimp rolls. I've had the seafood dishes, the Korean beef and Moo Shu scrimp, the scrimp and vegetables and the Moo shu beef dinners. All were great and always take some home. I'll probably be returning back very soon. The staff was very patient and helpful. My wife always gets the combo fried rice dish.

data.title: I don't even like raw fish
data.text:
But I can tell you honestly I tried the sashimi and I loved it. I really don't like raw fish and normally I wouldn't have even tried it if I hadn't come with my boss and coworkers. The food was delicious and we had an amazing bottle of whiskey to go along with it. I loved the wait-staff who were very attentive and kind. They really tried to accommodate everyone.

Definitely make the effort to stop by even once. You'll not regret it.

data.title: Expensive, but decent food..
data.text: This restaurant was in the same strip as our hotel so we stopped into this place. The staff was nice. The food was okay but over priced. When you have Asian food, you don't expect a $45 ticket for 3 people. My daughter loved the moo shoo pork though. They also use a lot of sauce in their vegetable dishes.

data.title: Nice clean, tasty and good staff
data.text: Took family here for dinner including 2 grandsons 5,3.  The service was good and the food was tasty and look very nice, so tasting with eyes first.  Prices were reasonable.  The atmosphere was clean, modern and fresh.   We had sushi and interesting calamari and Chinese dishes which 8 of us shared including the young ones.  Made for a nice family dinner.

data.title: Good food and service all around.
data.text: We arrived before happy hour ended, which turned out to be a great deal! (I want to say we arrived before 6). ANY 3 rolls on their menu for $20, plus drink specials.  We loved the rolls we tried and the tuna poke, plus we sampled a couple of their cocktails (tasty and refreshing).  Waiter was super friendly and provided great table service.  Would definitely go back if in the area.

data.title: Some things are better than others
data.text: I have had their Chinese menu.  Just okay.  I don't eat sushi but they serve it there and I have been with those who imbibe say that it's good.  I do love the Tempura there.  One of the best I have ever had.  They also have delicious scallion pancakes.  I like this restaurant for their happy hour.  I can go and order a bunch of apps for a reasonable price and it's enough for several people to make a meal.  Disadvantage: it's usually pretty busy being in the same parking lot as Michael's, HEB and Alamo Draft House.

data.title: Best Crab Rangoon
data.text: Even though this restaurant is in a mall area, it is very attractive inside and the food is excellent.  We had several appetizers, and the crab Rangoon was outstanding, perhaps the best I have ever had.  Also had fried dumplings and tempura shrimp, which were good.  We shared on entrée of shrimp and broccoli with a very good brown sauce. The food came quickly and service was very good.

data.title: Best Asian Food in Area
data.text: I had dined at the downtown Austin location many times and thought it was the best Asian food in Austin.  Now we have a Cedar Park location.  What a blast.  The food is scrumptious.....

data.title: Good Happy Hour / neat choices
data.text: In Austin, TX &  2nd location, which is an Austin address, but on the border of Cedar Park.  Lunch & dinner menus are on-line. Happy Hour special are priced at a good rate. I have not had a poor lunch nor dinner here. Servers are focus to provide all that they can. A good variety of excellent happy hour cocktails are sure to please. I go to this place about twice a quarter. Just across the parking lot from the Alamo Drafthouse (Movies), it is quick meal prior to watching a great movie too. Clean interior and lunch/dinner are equally good to try for a "whole food" type of meal.

data.title: Sure glad I tried this place
data.text: Really enjoyed eating here for the first time.  The sauteed shrimp dishes are wonderful.  Very large shrimp, prepared well, and cooked to perfection.  You can tell the owner is passionate about making sure each guest has a great experience and it all revolves around wonderful food.  Rolls were done well.  Didn't get the sense sashimi was their favorite thing to prepare best but tasted ok.

data.title: Awesome Chinese food and customer service!
data.text: I went a couple days ago with my family since we were all craving Chinese food. We loved the restaurant's atmosphere. We were welcomed by our waitress, Anna, and she was great! She was very polite, friendly, and took a great care of us and the food were amazing! I loved their Hot & Sour soup and Orange chicken! Would love to come back.

data.title: Very good
data.text:
Went for lunch and are from the lunch menu which was very well priced. 
The restaurant is very clean and in prime shape as would be expected since the building and furnishings are brand new. Casual and appropriately furnished for a neighborhood shopping center.
I ate off the lunch menu which was quite extensive and fairly priced. It included soup as well as the entree and most prices were from 6 to 9 dollars. I had the general tso's chicken and the hot and sour soup. I would rate them as very good, have had better but have had lots not nearly as good. Will return to try other items.

data.title: Best hot sour soup in town
data.text: The most incredible food in Cedar Park, with a great atmosphere and personal supervision by the owner. Very clean and relaxing place and I  want to recomend the hot sour soup is the best and the chicken fried rice in awesome.

data.title: Great Addition to Cedar Park
data.text: I have been to this spot twice and both times the sushi was fresh and well prepared. I have not had any other dishes but they look appealing and well presented. The prices are reasonable and the service was very good.
